alert.note: Alert for Central Middlesex County; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Southeast Middlesex; Suffolk; Western Norfolk; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 12:52PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Areas of will impact portions of northeastern Norfolk, Suffolk, east central Middlesex and northwestern Plymouth Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 1249 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking areas of slow moving heavy rain over Abington, moving northwest at 10 mph. Rain rates have been between 1.5 to 2 inches in the last hour from these heavy showers. HAZARD...Minor nuisance flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas, especially in parts of the Greater Boston area. Be alert to the dangers of hydroplaning. Locations impacted include... Boston, Cambridge, Brockton, Quincy, Newton, Somerville, Waltham, Brookline, Medford, Weymouth, Revere, Everett, Braintree, Chelsea, Randolph, Watertown, Needham, Wellesley, Milton and Stoughton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed.

area.areaDesc: Central Middlesex County; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Southeast Middlesex; Suffolk; Western Norfolk; Western Plymouth
